other_tests.findings: Lamellated myelin-like inclusions in the cytoplasm of glomerular and tubular cells; Lacunar brain infarction, opacified lens, and angiokeratoma detected.

other_tests.changes_over_time: At age 48, MRI demonstrated new infarctions at the left pons and bilateral cerebral cortex.

other_tests.findings: Remarkable declines in Orientation, Language (Comprehension, Naming), Construction, Memory, Calculations and Reasoning (Similarities, Judgement); relatively good scores maintained for Attention and Language Repetition.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Cognitive function tests at ages 49, 50, and 51 showed HDS-R scores of 6, 4, and 4 points, and MMSE scores of 15, 17, and 10 points, respectively, indicating progression to severe dementia.

other_tests.procedure_name: Voxel-based Specific Regional Analysis System for Alzheimer's Disease
other_tests.findings: Z-score of 0.49 indicating no specific loss of gray matter selectivity in bilateral hippocampal regions; reduction in whole brain gray matter volume was 6.02%, suggesting no atrophy despite multiple brain infarctions.
